private_information: I can observe the left portion of the table and verify legality of moves.
I know the standard Blocks World rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
blockmover_1.goal: Analyze the given initial arrangement and the action sequence. Produce a step-by-step state trace after each action and report whether each action is legal according to Blocks World rules.

private_information: I can observe the right portion of the table and verify legality of moves.
I know the labels of the blocks: A B C D E F G and the same Blocks World rules.
blockmover_2.goal: Analyze the given initial arrangement and the action sequence. Produce a step-by-step state trace after each action and report whether each action is legal according to Blocks World rules.

private_information: I coordinate the agents and must produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' analyses and produce a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the initial state, the allowed actions, and the final arrangement derived from the action sequence.

public_information: This is a Blocks World domain with blocks A, B, C, D, E, F, G.
Standard Blocks World rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on top of B, B is on top of E, C is on the table, D is on top of A, E is on the table, F is on the table, G is on top of F.

Action sequence to execute in order: pickup(C), stack(C, G), unstack(C, G), stack(C, D), unstack(C, D), stack(C, D), unstack(C, D), stack(C, G), unstack(D, A), stack(D, C), unstack(A, B), stack(A, D), unstack(B, E), putdown(B), pickup(E), stack(E, B), unstack(E, B), putdown(E), unstack(A, D), stack(A, B).
Final arrangement derived from the initial configuration and the action sequence: A is on B, B is on the table, C is on G, D is on C, E is on the table, F is on the table, G is on F.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent that inspects a Blocks World initial state and an explicit action sequence. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a clear, step-by-step state trace after each action in the sequence, and indicate for each action whether it is legal and why. If information is missing, state the missing assumption explicitly.
analysis.prompt: Your name is blockmover_1. You receive the public information about the Blocks World initial arrangement and the action sequence. You have the following private information: {agents->blockmover_1->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->blockmover_1->goal}. Provide a JSON-style trace of the world state after each action and a short legality check for each action.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an agent that inspects a Blocks World initial state and an explicit action sequence. Do not produce PDDL. Provide a clear, step-by-step state trace after each action in the sequence, and indicate for each action whether it is legal and why. If information is missing, state the missing assumption explicitly.
analysis.prompt: Your name is blockmover_2. You receive the public information about the Blocks World initial arrangement and the action sequence. You have the following private information: {agents->blockmover_2->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->blockmover_2->goal}. Provide a JSON-style trace of the world state after each action and a short legality check for each action.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling. Integrate agent analyses and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem that are compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain encodes standard Blocks World actions (pickup, putdown, stack, unstack) and the problem encodes the given initial state and the final arrangement derived from the action sequence. Keep agent reasoning separate if multiple agent-specific actions are needed.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the analyses from two agents which contain step-by-step traces and legality checks: {plan_blockmover_1} and {plan_blockmover_2}. Your objective is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Use the public information {environment->public_information} plus the agents' analyses to produce a FastDownwards-compatible PDDL domain and PDDL problem that reflect the initial state and the final arrangement. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
